simlib.energy.Angle¶

class simlib.energy.Angle(xyz0, xyz1, xyz2, ideal_value=1.0, force_constant=1.0)[source]¶

Compute the potential energy of an angle.

The energy of an angle follows the harmonic potential:

\[U = \frac{1}{2} k (\theta - \theta_0)^2\]

The derivative must be split by the components of vectors \(u\) and \(v\), which are used to compute the angle \(\theta\):

\[F = -\frac{\delta U}{\delta x} = k (\theta - \theta_0) sin^{-1}(\theta) / |v|\]
\[\frac{\delta U}{\delta v_x} = -k (\theta - \theta_0) sin^{-1}(\theta) / |u|\]

The derivation:

\[\frac{\delta U}{\delta \theta} = k (\theta - \theta_0)\]
\[\theta = acos(\hat{u_{ij}} \cdot \hat{u_{jk}})\]
\[\frac{\delta \theta}{\delta u \cdot v} = \frac{-1}{\sqrt{1 - (\hat{u} \cdot \hat{v})^2}} = \frac{-1}{\sqrt{1 - cos^2(\theta)}} = \frac{-1}{\sqrt{sin^2(\theta)}} = \frac{-1}{sin(\theta)} = sin^{-1}(\theta)\]
\[u_i = [x, y, z]\]
\[\frac{\delta u_i}{\delta x} = 1\]
\[u \cdot v = u_x v_x + u_y v_y + u_z v_z\]
\[\delta (\^{u} \cdot \^{v}) = u \frac{dv}{dx} v \frac{du}{dx}\]
\[\delta (\^{u} \cdot \^{v}) = u \frac{dv}{dx} v \frac{du}{dx}\]
\[u = [\Delta x, \Delta y, \Delta z]\]

f1 = dth/duv / |u| * (u * (cos th / |u|) - v / |v|) = dth/duv / |u| * (u * costh - v) f3 = dth/duv / |v| * (v * (cos th / |v|) - u / |u|) = dth/duv / |v| * (v * costh - u) f2 = -1 * (f1 + f3)

\[\frac{\delta u}{\delta \Delta x} = [1, 1, 1]\]
\[\frac{\delta (u \cdot v)}{\delta u_x} = v_x\]
\[\frac{\delta (u \cdot v)}{\delta v_x} = u_x\]
